page.title: 07A VILLAGE COMMUNITY-TUNSTALL
page.content: Tunstall is a small village with approximately 190 residents. It is a long narrow village divided by a road and a stream. In the centre of the village are the church, the village shop and the public house. At one end of the village is a small neat council housing estate, the majority of other houses are owner occupied. The emphasis is on family life with the welfare of the children being of prime importance. Fresh food is produced in gardens and cooked in modernised kitchens, many having microwave ovens. Time consuming chores are cut to a minimum to allow the family to have time together, watching television and videos. Board games are still very popular for indoors and sport is a favourite outdoor pursuit. Many families have a household pet, dogs proving to be the most popular.
